sen.j: 白折（しらおれ）は、日本茶の一種で玉露や煎茶の製造過程で取り除かれた茎の部分を集めたもので、茎独特の味がある。
sen.e: Shiraore is a type of Japanese tea that consists of tea stems eliminated from Gyokuro (refined green tea) or green tea (of middle grade) processing and has an unique flavor derived from stems.
Shiraore is a type of Japanese tea that consists of tea stems eliminated from Gyokuro (refined green tea) or green tea of middle grade in processing and has an unique flavor derived from stems.
Shiraore is a type of Japanese tea that consists of tea stems eliminated from Gyokuro (refined green tea) or green tea of middle grade in processing and has an unique flavor derived from stems.
It is one type of a kuki-cha (stem tea).
It is one type of kuki-cha (stem tea).
It is one type of kuki-cha (stem tea).

sen.j: 京都（関西）では、玉露の白折のことを雁ヶ音（かりがね）と呼び、高級茶として有名である。
sen.e: The shiraore of Gyokuro is called as karigane in Kyoto city (Kansai Region) and is a well known expensive tea.
The shiraore of Gyokuro is called karigane in Kyoto city (Kansai Region) and is a well known expensive tea.
The shiraore of Gyokuro is called karigane in Kyoto city (Kansai Region) and is a well known high-grade tea.
